name: Mount Everest
hint: Highest peak on Earth at 8,849 meters, on the Nepal-China border

name: K2
hint: Second-highest mountain on Earth, on the Pakistan-China border

name: Kangchenjunga
hint: Third-highest mountain, on the Nepal-India border

name: Lhotse
hint: Fourth-highest mountain, connected to Everest via the South Col

name: Makalu
hint: Fifth-highest mountain on Earth, located in the Mahalangur Himalayas

name: Annapurna
hint: One of the most dangerous eight-thousanders in Nepal, first 8000m peak climbed

name: Nanga Parbat
hint: Known as 'Killer Mountain' in Pakistan, ninth-highest peak in the world

name: Mount Fuji
hint: Japan's highest peak and most iconic volcano

name: Mount Elbrus
hint: Highest peak in Europe (and the Caucasus), a dormant volcano in Russia

name: Mount Damavand
hint: Highest volcano in Asia, located in Iran's Alborz range

name: Cho Oyu
hint: Sixth-highest mountain in the world, considered the easiest 8000m peak to climb

name: Dhaulagiri
hint: Seventh-highest mountain in the world, its name means 'White Mountain' in Sanskrit

name: Manaslu
hint: Eighth-highest mountain, located in the Nepalese Himalayas' Mansiri Himal range

name: Mount Kinabalu
hint: Highest peak in Borneo, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Malaysian Sabah

name: Mount Ararat
hint: Snow-capped peak in eastern Turkey, legendary resting place of Noah's Ark

name: Mount Pinatubo
hint: Philippine volcano whose 1991 eruption was one of the largest in the 20th century

name: Mount Krakatoa
hint: Infamous Indonesian volcano between Java and Sumatra, erupted catastrophically in 1883

name: Mount Bromo
hint: Active volcano in East Java, Indonesia, surrounded by a vast sea of sand

name: Gasherbrum I
hint: Eleventh-highest mountain, also called Hidden Peak, in the Karakoram range

name: Mount Kazbek
hint: Dormant stratovolcano in the Caucasus, steeped in Georgian and Greek mythology

name: Tirich Mir
hint: Highest peak of the Hindu Kush range, located in Pakistan's Chitral district

name: Puncak Jaya
hint: Highest peak on the island of New Guinea, in Indonesia's Papua province

name: Mount Hallasan
hint: Highest peak in South Korea, a shield volcano on Jeju Island

name: Mount Aso
hint: Active volcano in Kyushu, Japan, with one of the world's largest calderas

name: Broad Peak
hint: Twelfth-highest mountain in the world, in the Karakoram range of Pakistan
